name: market for liquefied petroleum gas | liquefied petroleum gas | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/19777/documentation

This is a market activity. Each market represents the consumption mix of a product in a given geography, connecting suppliers with consumers of the same product in the same geographical area. Markets group the producers and also the imports of the product (if relevant) within the same geographical area. They also account for transport to the consumer and for the losses during that process, when relevant.;This is the market for  'liquefied petroleum gas', in the geography of Europe without Switzerland.;LPG is generally expected to be traded on a global level.This market activity is meant to represent the average LPG consumption mix in Europe without Switzerland between 2010 and 2016 and is based on European trade data:; About 50% of LPG (in the range of 53.3%-63.2% of total trade quantities between 2010-2016) used in EU28 is imported to EU28 from outside (excluding Norway and Switzerland) the Union. The export quantities were low compared to the import quantities (the ratio export/import was in the range of 0.02-0.02 in the same period).;Source: Eurostat database, EU trade since 1988 by HS6Â (DS-016893), HS6-code: G_271112, Assessed on: 2018-01-09.;This dataset was created as a copy of the "market for liquefied petroleum gas, CH 2008". Data for losses, energy use and waste disposal were taken over from the Swiss market dataset, uncertainties were adjusted accordingly. Transport distance based on EuroStat freight transport statistics (see comments of the individual exchanges for details).;liquefied petroleum gas' is a fossil fuel with a calorific value of 45.5 MJ/kg. It is used as a liquid fuel and is sourced from petroleum refineries. Its main applications are in the following sectors: domestic cooking and heating and automotive fuel.

This datasets begins with liquefied natural gas leaving the production site or the importing harbour, ready for distribution in Europe.

Dataset includes LPG production and distribution. Filling station is considered. Losses at loading, unloading and refuelling are included.

exchanges.description: Transport distance based on eurostat transport statistics for railway transport of goods. The transport data was extracted from the database leaf "Railway transport - goods transported, by group of goods - from 2008 onwards based on NST 2007 (1 000 t, million tkm) (rail_go_grpgood)" (http://ec.europa.eu/eurostat/data/database) on the 2018-06-01. The transport distance was calculated based on the total mass of goods transported and total payload-distance for the NST 2007 category "GT07 - Coke and refined petroleum products" in the year 2016 for all countries for which data was available. The average distance of railway transport for goods in this category in 2016 was 271 km. The fraction of goods transported by rail (in terms of mass) relative to the total mass of goods transported by road, rail and inland waterways was 22.2% in 2016. Therefore, the average distance that goods travelled by rail in 2016 was 60 km. This value is assumed to be representative for Europe.

exchanges.description: Transport distance based on eurostat transport statistics for road freight transport. The transport data was extracted from the database leaf "Annual road freight transport, by type of goods and type of transport (1 000 t, Mio Tkm), from 2008 onwards (road_go_ta_tg)" (http://ec.europa.eu/eurostat/data/database) on the 2018-06-01. The transport distance was calculated based on the total mass of goods transported and total payload-distance for the NST 2007 category "GT07 - Coke and refined petroleum products" in the year 2016 for all countries for which data was available. The average distance of road transport for goods in this category in 2016 was 102 km. The fraction of goods transported by road (in terms of mass) relative to the total mass of goods transported by road, rail and inland waterways was 65.8% in 2016. Therefore, the average distance that goods travelled by road in 2016 was 67 km. This value is assumed to be representative for Europe.

exchanges.description: Transport distance based on eurostat transport statistics for transport of goods by inland waterways. The transport data was extracted from the database leaf "Transport by type of good (from 2007 onwards with NST2007) (iww_go_atygo)" (http://ec.europa.eu/eurostat/data/database) on the 2018-06-01. The transport distance was calculated based on the total mass of goods transported and total payload-distance for the NST 2007 category "GT07 - Coke and refined petroleum products" in the year 2016 for the European Union (current composition). The average distance of transport by inland waterways for goods in this category in 2016 was 250 km. The fraction of goods transported by inland waterways (in terms of mass) relative to the total mass of goods transported by road, rail and inland waterways was 12% in 2016. Therefore, the average distance that goods travelled by inland waterways in 2016 was 30 km. This value is assumed to be representative for Europe.
